results.title: Heart of the matter
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fit to Live”.
Part of an instructional film series from 1969-70 about the training of Australia’s youth. Thirteen colour films of ten minutes duration were made under the auspices of the Cultural Council for National Fitness. The films focus on National Fitness Camps, sports, family recreation and exercises for people of all ages. Sponsored by the Shell Company, the films were made to emphasis the need for physical fitness amongst all age groups. This film deals with the prevention and rehabilitation of heart disease through exercise.

results.title: Heart of Pearl
results.creator_credit: Andrew G Taylor, Jo-Anne McGowan and AFTRS
results.brief_description: An old soldier is trapped in time. Only a ticking watch separates his ritual from the enveloping jungle … ‘Heart of Pearl’ is based on stories of Japanese soldiers who remained in hiding in the jungle for decades after the end of World War II.

results.title: Heart of Otara
results.brief_description: Otara has the reputation as one of the most dangerous places in New Zealand. But for Sami, who now lives in Australia, Otara will always remain in his heart as home, as the land of his father and his family. Proud of his color and proud of his culture, Sami talks of his memories as a child, the good times and the bad including the tragic circumstances which eventually led to a new start and a new beginning in Australia. Music composed by Sami Laga.

results.title: Heart of darkness
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Rick Rosenberg, Robert W. Christiansen and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Joseph Conrad’s classic tale features Tim Roth as Marlow, the British Captain travelling deep into the heart of Africa’s Congo River, and John Malkovich as the elusive Kurtz, a god to native tribes. It is a search that will take them deep into the evil darkness that lurks within the heart of man. Cast includes Tim Roth, John Malkovich, Isaach Bankole, James Fox and Morten Faldaas.

results.title: Heart of a stallion
results.creator_credit: Lew Landers, Carl Laemmle, Universal Pictures and Castle Films
results.brief_description: Excerpts from the 1935 feature film “Stormy” starring Noah Beery and Jean Rogers. Stormy (Noah Beery) goes in search of a lost horse - a victim of a train wreck. His search leads him into mountainous country where he encounters rustlers who plan to slaughter a whole herd of horses.

results.title: Heart of a city
results.creator_credit: Ralph W Peterson, Brian Chirlian, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Ajax Films
results.brief_description: Documentary about Queensland’s capital city, Brisbane: the people, cultural events, city and environs. The role of government departments in the city including local government, council planners and Brisbane City Council. Cinematographer/Director of Photography: Keith Loone.

results.title: Heart condition
results.creator_credit: James D. Parriott, Steve Tisch and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: A tough cop and a cunning lawyer begin an unlikely alliance when they partner up to find a murderer. Mooney (Bob Hoskins), a tough and bigoted cop suffers a near fatal heart attack while on the job. His life is saved by a successful heart transplant, courtesy of the recently assassinated lawyer, Stone (Denzel Washington). There is only one unexpected side effect from the operation; Stone’s ghost accompanies the transplanted organ. They discover they share more than the operation in common when it transpires that Stone’s hooker girlfriend is the former girlfriend of Mooney. The two have different priorities however, and while Mooney wants to regain his former girlfriend, Stone wants to find his killer, making for a confusion between body and mind. Also starring Chloe Webb.

results.title: Heart Attacks
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Explains the oxygen supply to the heart. Examines various abnormal heart conditions. Signs and symptoms for angina and coronary occlusion and emergency treatment required.

results.title: Heart attack
results.creator_credit: Imre Horvath and CBS News Production
results.brief_description: America’s number one killer is the heart attack and if you are going to have one, you’re better off having it in Seattle. This is the opening message of this film which shows that it is necessary to deal with a coronary in the first crucial moments.
